channel.title: A. Schollwöck's Blog
channel.description: Recent content on A. Schollwöck's Blog

item.title: Typesafe SQL - Part 1
item.description: SQL is like a universal skill you aquire once and can use anywhere you work with when storing data. In whatever environment I’m in, whichever programming language I’m using, it is still the same. There are plenty of libraries and frameworks out there to integrate it in your favorite language. Also they follow usually one of two styles:

item.title: Continuing blogging
item.description: Hello dear readers, as I have teasered in my post before we will have a talk about SQL. Example of sql with wrong types Example of sql with wrong types which could be catched by compiler Reference to jooq Code generation Source Code generator in .NET 5/6 I’m plan on doing a write up the next couple of days of a project of mine regarding C# and SQL.

item.title: Starting blogging - really
item.description: Latley I have been listening a lot to Jordan Peterson. No, not because of his viral videos arguing for/against feminism and other such topics I don’t even want to get into. They are political and I don’t want to discuss those topics here. Instead I started hearing him on those… “Motivational” videos in which you can really get stuck, feel hyped and waste a ton of your time.

item.title: Konditionsverwaltung
item.description: Versionsverwaltung Versionsnr. Grund der Änderung Geändert am 1 Initiale Erstellung 2021-01-10 Einleitung Im folgenden werden die Ziele und der Nutzen auf Basis einer Situtation beschrieben. Ausgangssituation Vertriebskonditionen treten in unterschiedlichen Formen auf. Diese sind unter Umständen teil von Verträgen und müssen dementsprechend verwaltet werden, so dass verhandelte Konditionen zu den richtigen Zeitpunkten zur Verfügung stehen.

item.title: About
item.description: I’m a programmer and interested in new technologies. At work and for personal projects I’m usually using boring technology. At work I’m not a full time programmer anymore, it changed to a more process oriented job. I blog about code, work, technology in general and basically everything that’s on my mind.
